moves.3... Nf6 4. Nf3 e6 5. Bg5: I decided to go for the early exchange with the hope of creating some kind of weakness on the kingside.
moves.5... h6 6. Bxf6 Qxf6 7. e3: a solid pawn structure against the slav
moves.7... Nd7 8. Bd3: developing move and supports my planned advance of the e-pawn.
moves.8... dxc4: deflecting the white bishop and gaining a slight tempo.
moves.9. Bxc4 g6: not what I was excepting. I was think black should have gone with ...Nb6; ...Bb4 or ...Be7
moves.10. O-O Bg7 11. Qc2: maintains control of the important e4 square.
moves.11... Qe7 12. Rfd1: I had to watch out for the possible attack on d4 via ..c5. Which would be like a can opener for black.
moves.12... O-O 13. Be2: keeping options open with shifting attacking plans to Rc1 with pressure down the c-file.
moves.13... a5 14. Ne4: hitting at all of black's weak points. Black has to do something about this knight.
moves.14... f5: Thus he is forced to create a long term weakness on e6 and g6
moves.16. e4: every flank attack should be met with an attack in the centre
moves.16... Re8 17. Rde1: support e4 and x-raying the black queen.
moves.17... Qf7 18. Bd3: e4 is well supported and f5 comes under attack.
moves.20. h5 g5: forced and white wins the f-pawn.
moves.21. exf5 exf5 22. Re2: threatening 23. Rae1 with a massive advantage.
moves.24. Bxf5: the pawn is won with a wonderfully placed bishop and dominance in the centre.
moves.25... b4 26. axb4 axb4: Now my rook can entre the game via the a-file.
moves.27. Na4: improving the influence of the knight which is headed to c5.
moves.27... Ba6 28. Nc5 Bb5 29. Bg6 Nxg6 30. h: defending d4 and wins the b4 pawn.
moves.35... Qd5 36. Qc2: the exchange of queens leads to a most likely long hard fought draw
moves.37... Rf8 38. Ng6 Ra8 39. Ne7+ Kh8 40. N: it is a draw if queens are gone and Qc2 wins another pawn.
moves.41... Bd3 42. Nxd3 Qxf5 43. Qxc6: ending is not in doubt now.
